intro: Scorzonera coronopifolia var. pinnatifida, commonly known as the narrow-leaved scorzonera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and finely divided, pinnatifid leaves that give it a delicate, fern-like appearance. The plant produces yellowish-green to reddish flowers in clustered heads, which are typical of the daisy family. It is native to regions of Europe and western Asia, often found in rocky or gravelly soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
